revised_title: The Influence of Music on Human Affections and Passions
tldr: In this letter, Dr. John Wallis discusses the historical effects of music on human affections and passions, comparing the music of past ages to that of the present. He explores the reasons behind the reported extraordinary effects of music in ancient times, such as the influence on birds, beasts, trees, and stones, and how these effects have diminished in later ages.
